name: unromantically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not typical of romantic love: I ask him to marry me, unromantically, one Monday night outside the pub. When I unwrapped the ring he unromantically announced that we were getting married.
in a way that is not exciting, mysterious, or special, but instead in a way that is practical or ordinary: The car is known rather unromantically as "chassis number 205". Cavolo nero is often known here, somewhat unromantically, as black cabbage.
More examplesFewer examplesWe struggled unromantically across the wild landscape, in the heavy sleet and freezing cold. Her boat is, unromantically, named after the company that is sponsoring her.The strong, beautiful, romantic ship lay, unromantically, among the working vessels.
